Reviews.AuthorLocation: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “very basic but clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Aisleen M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a university trip to Amsterdam and our expectations were not high at all, however we were all pleasently surprised when we arrived, staff were all very friendly! Stayed on the 3rd floor, stairs are a nightmare, ridiculously steep and no lift, you get a key card to let you into the room, Room was spacious, 3 single beds, bright, clean, towels provided, and unsuite was very clean. There was a few problems with the pressure and temperature of the shower but we got our hair washed none the less. Breakfast is served in the morning, very basic, cereal, rice cakes, toast, and coffee, tea, and apple juice, but this did the job! Tram line right outside, close to centre! If your not fussed on luxery its perfect!

Reviews.Title: “charged a further 220 euro after we had already paid upfront for private room”
Reviews.Author: irishgirl1988
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days in march 2012, paid quite a bit for this hostel due to the fact that I needed somewhere decent to stay, biggest mistake of my trip, not only did we pay upfront for the room we were told on arrival that there was no smoking however we smoked in the room and were forced to pay a 100 euro fine plus when we handed in our room keys they refused to refund the 20 euro for these stating that this would also contribute to us smoking in the room, fair enough we broke the rules but 120 euro when absolutely nothing was destroyed?? extortionate!! to add insult to injury we left the hostel for one day and returned to stay in a more expensive private room WHICH WE HAD ALREADY PAID FOR but were informed by staff that we had to pay a FURTHER 100 EURO if we wanted to stay in this hostel, refused and asked for a refund but this was not an option as apparently we were canceling the room, we were being forced to cancel due to the fact we did not have the money to pay and we were refused a refund for canceling. ABSOLUTE JOKE WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOSTEL TO ANYONE WHO WANTS SOMEWHERE NICE TO STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but very clean - all you need”
Reviews.Author: samrich77
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with my girlfriend on an organised trip. We were initially sceptical because of the mixed reviews on here. However, we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is basic, but the rooms, en suite and communal areas were very clean. The rooms we stayed in contained three single beds, which were comfortable and fresh towels were in the cupboard (no additional cost as previously stated). The breakfast was basic and self service - a choice of cereals, toast, rice crackers, fresh tea/coffee and fruit juices. Internet was available in the reception area, but wifi was free throughout the hotel (again, not just on the ground floor as previously stated). Rooms were accessible using swipe cards, which also controlled access to the hotel entrance. We did not experience any excessive noise problems from other guests. Close to supermarket and tram lines, very central location. Vending machine in lobby sells tins of beer for E1,5 or softdrinks. Overall very satisfied with our stay and would reccommend to friends. Nothing fancy, but a good base.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in much worse, but can get better in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: twentyfourthworld
Reviews.Content: + Bedroom was very clean, with a big sink area and mirror which was handy + Wifi a big plus + Good location and easy to find (right by the Heineken brewery). Could walk to museumplein, red light district, etc. (would recommend a tram for the train station though!) + Hostel seemed quite secure and wasn't too loud - Rooms were tiny, when sharing with people you don't know it seemed to really lack personal space. - Seemed like we paid hotel prices for a bog standard hostel. We did book late, so just try to book early and you'll get something in Amsterdam that's much better for the same price. (We were paying 25 each per night) -Not enough showers! One per floor?! Waited 30 mins one morning, annoying when you want to just get out and explore. So if you've made a booking here don't worry, you'll enjoy Amsterdam and there's nothing terrible about the hostel, if you're looking to book now I'd recommend shopping around online, I've stayed in several better places in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Nothing too fancy but did the job”
Reviews.Author: amarat
Reviews.Content: We were hoping to save some money so this hotel/hostel was perfect. We upgraded in the bathroom suite but the shared bathrooms didn't seem too occupied. Internet connection sucked on the third floor (where our room was) so that was annoying but not as big of a deal. Staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nastiest Place I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Aud1230
Reviews.Content: I honestly have no idea how other reviews said this place was clean. I have stayed in budget hotels and hostels all around the world (20 countries) and this was by far the nastiest, dirtiest place I have ever stayed in. To start off with, it is in a shady area of Amsterdam, though it is convenient by tram. It was easy to find, and we were buzzed in fairly shortly after we rang to be let in. The check in area is tiny. Teeny tiny. Our room was past the check in area, so anytime we came and left we had to squeeze by them, if there was even room. We walked to our room and noticed that all luggage storage was directly in front of our room (and the other 4 rooms around there). There was no one watching it, so if I wanted to steal anything it would have been very easy. DO NOT PLAN TO LEAVE YOUR BAGS HERE. Inside our room, I was completely disgusted. It was filthy. The front desk had told us "Smoking is forbidden in you rooms, this is very important". Well, our comforters were filthy (actually covered in dirty) and covered in cigarette holes! There were spiders and other creepy crawlies throughout the room, cobwebs everywhere, and the shelf in it was covered in dust. The carpet was coming up all over the room, and was literally taped back down with lime green tape. Needless to say, the carpet was the dirtiest carpet I have ever laid eyes upon. I never walked on it with bare feet. The bathroom was also very dirty. It had a certain grunge to it that I just cannot put into words. The shower did have hot water, but the water pressure was so low I could barely wash my hair. This was the worst I have ever been ripped off by staying at a hotel. It was seriously gross, and I would honestly suggest just sleeping on the street before going to this place. It was terrible - do not give them your money!

Reviews.Title: “It was really good”
Reviews.Author: cataherrera
Reviews.Content: The hostel has very good, nice rooms, very clean and the personnel was very nice

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeanie1283
Reviews.Content: Good budget hotel. Nice location. It was well secured with cameras on each floor. We stayed in a ensuite room on the third floor. Room was big enough and clean. Bathroom was clean. Rooms are not cleaned everyday but we only stayed for 2 nights so it was alright. Tram stops are nearby. quite close to the centraal station. Staff were very helpful. No wireless connection on the third floor. Overall it was alright.

Reviews.Title: “Wow.. thats a lot of stairs..”
Reviews.Author: Carlystar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a 2 month tour of Europe. The hotel is quite old and expensive for what you get compared to other hostels we stayed at in Europe. We were on the top floor and the stairs were steep with small steps not the most pleasant time trying to carry all your suitcases up there. We had a 3 person private room and bathroom. The bathroom was good size however the room was old and had a huge whole in the wall that had my friend stuffing her towel in so no bugs could come out. There was a beam in the room which caused issues when sitting up in bed. The location was OK. Close to the Heineken factory and walking distance to all the things you needed. The bus stop was across the road with cafes around the corner. Reception were OK, not overly friendly but answered our questions when we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty is not the word to use, it worst than nasty”
Reviews.Author: chipmonks_10
Reviews.Content: The location was good, getting in from a long flight IN THE MORNING and also very tired to be greeted rudely by front desk person who actually had us waiting in the lounge for an hour.. . The lounge was also gloomy and dirty with dirty dishes on the tables. The room is very small and the beds are very uncomfortable. My comforter had blood stains all over and there was a awful smell coming from the bathroom. I will advise travellers do not stay at this hotel you will be very disappointed with the way you are treated by the guy who works the morning shift and atmosphere of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Try to Avoid”
Reviews.Author: wiechake
Reviews.Content: This hotel was hardly better than a cheap hostel. The sheets weren't clean and there wsa no soap in the bathroom. Only a few rooms had a bathroom attached and all other rooms shared a single bathroom in the hall. Breakfast was typical, bread and cereal, and the location was alright

Reviews.Title: “Steep”
Reviews.Author: dhrubo
Reviews.Content: Don't stay there if your don't like stairs. Anything above the ground floor is a massive trek. Otherwise the rooms are moderate if not slightly stale. The name does the place justice. Perfect for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cancellation due to strike”
Reviews.Author: ma2L
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for 3. The hotel was correct but expensive for a budget hotel. Unfortunately, the owner was very rigid. Due to a major train strike in Belgium, we had to cancel the last night upon arrival at the hotel. There was no way of getting any refund whatsoever for the last night, not even a small commercial gesture on their part. We do understand their strict policy for cancellation but this was a very exceptional circumstance.

Reviews.Title: “simple, clean, great staff”
Reviews.Author: alexams
Reviews.Content: was there this mounth it was very simple hotel as they say in there site, no place for party but just few minutes away there is great bars, resturants, musuumes, ets, very nice staff, helpful clean basic rooms. cheap breakfast 5 euro eat and drink as much as you want, free wirless internet in all the hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Stay if you must...”
Reviews.Author: Steedappeal
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor to Amsterdam I have stayed in most of the major neighborhoods around the city. This hostel is located a bit out of right field in a neither here-nor-there 'hood- definitely not my first choice. It is a solid 25+ minute walk from Centraal station. The main positive is that it is a reasonable walk to the charming, concentric Jordaan canal district. I needed a basic rm for the night and this was it at 45 euros. This is a depressing property with a sour smell of smoke lingering in the hallways. Surprisingly, the bathroom was in very good shape- in sharp contrast to the the room itself (# 3) which looked like someone had just been evicted. I didn't hear too much noise so I slept as well as I normally do when abroad. There was reasonable internet and even Skype service at a single terminal in the Reception area. Reception shuts down at 11 pm-ish so it is essential you remember the Front door code that they gave you. I didn't make it to Breakfast or the common area; I would heartily recommend that you take Breakfast outside the hotel (there is an attractive bagel shop several blocks south on the way back towards the Damrak). A room for the night and not much else in a city where finding a room below 50 euros is very elusive.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and dirty”
Reviews.Author: ceinwenharris
Reviews.Content: Euphemia Hotel should most definately not be advertised as a hotel, not even a budget one. We paid 100 Euros a night for a tiny cramped ensuite room. The bed linen was ripped and dirty, the shower drain was blocked and we felt like we were staying in a prison cell. If this 'Hotel' had been advertised as a hostel and been a LOT cheaper we may not have felt as badly about it, but it was very overpriced and left us feeling tainted about our stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: angiebabyLondon
Reviews.Content: The place was creepy. Clean but creepy. Great location. Tram to center and right across from heineken brewery. walking distance to Museum quarter and all that jazz. For the price, it was spot on. Private shower kept filling up. Room 23 has a bad shower - take note.

Reviews.Title: “Below Budget Hotel Euphemia”
Reviews.Author: Dallass
Reviews.Content: We stayed in double room on the first floor in May for 3 nights. The room was very cold and the heating did not work. The worst shower was terrible - the worst that I have ever had. The walls and ceilings are paper thin so make sure you take earplugs or else you won't get any sleep. The room was clean and the hotel is close to the tram line, but for 76 Euro per night it just isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: cf_bib
Reviews.Content: Room was clean on the 1st floor. We were three with a single bed each. The communal shower was warm and powerful. There's no curfew and the reception isn't attended after 11pm. They call you at 9am on departure day to ensure you get up. The buffet breakfast was EUR5 per person but none of us had it. There is no elevator and the stairs are steep. Like others, I would recommend the Mellow Yellow cafe closeby as well as the Heineken brewery. Also it's only a few stops on the tram from the Centraalstation. The staff were friendly and helpful. Overall it was very good for the price per head we paid. I'd recommend it as a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: potatomaster
Reviews.Content: The pictures on their website looked nice, but we were given a very different room. It was dark, dingy and on the first floor (street level). We couldn't open the curtains because people would look right in. We were even a little afraid to leave our belongings and trust that they would be there when we returned. In addition, the bathroom was not very clean and the room was just unpleasant. Thankfully it was our first night of the trip, so the jetlag put us to sleep. Luckily we were just passing through Amsterdam and only staying one night. For over 100 Euro a night, this was a terrible value.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel of very good standard”
Reviews.Author: Katiejo81
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the euphemia hotel in summer of 2004 for 2 nights and were pleasantly suprised on arrival to find friendly, helpful staff and a very clean and tidy double ensuite room. It is in a very good location on a lovely quiet side street, with most places of interest within walking distance. Although there was building work going on outside it was a relatively quiet hotel with no curfew and great coffee shop (mellow yellow) and cafes nearby. I was very impressed with this budget hotel and its cheap prices and i am going back this Sept.

Reviews.Title: “best shower in the world EVER!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the euphemia in november 2001 and although the staff are a bit unfriendly, the accomodation was exactly what we needed: no curfew, quiet street and literally the best shower in the world ever! The mellow yellow coffeeshop just round the corner is cool and so were all the people we met staying at the euphemia. Definitely a hostel though, but just right for those of us who don't want to hear 15 other people snoring at night! Will absolutely go back on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there in summer of 2000 --- loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in the summer of 2000, and it was excellent! The stairs ARE steep, but for the price, a clean, private room with bath was unbeatable! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Should be a hostel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double ensuite room in May. Clean rooms, a few fag burns on the bedding and a distinct smell of weed in the corridor. Expensive for what it was. Staff seemed nice. Central(ish) location. Lots of works outside so was loud in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but was cheap, steep stairs.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel as part of a group of 40 rugby players on tour around the amsterdam area. The location was good as we were only 10 minutes walk from the cities main area for night life, rembrant square, the red light area etc. Every member of the party seemed to have enjoyed themselves. The staff were very helpful despite having 40 chaps there for a drunken weekend. If you are considering staying at this hotel i would remember that it is not the most plush hotel you'll find in Amsterdam but for the money it was more than adequate. In future if i was to stay in Amsterdam on a budget again i would certainly consider staying at the hotel euphemia.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were lookin for.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this summer with 2 friends and it was cheap, clean and we found the staff to be helpful and friendly. A little bit of a walk from Central station but otherwise it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “stayed there october 02”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in october 02, cool staff and great location. good price!

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes Bad is Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there one night too many with our three daughters during the summer of 1999. It was amazingly dirty. Nothing like the picture shown on the internet. We are forever grateful to Ismael for directing us to the Hotel Asterisk the next day. Kate Noah and family

HotelInfo.Name: Euphemia Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Fokke Simonszstraat 1-9, Amsterdam 1017 TD, The Netherlands
